intro: Nassauvia glomerulosa, commonly known as the clustered nassauvia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Nassauvia glomerulosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought-prone regions.
